body: Fixes #215. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281)

comment_regular_data.body:
Review status: 0 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2654 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWhHzubNwc90X2tnMSt:-KWhHzubNwc90X2tnMSu:b-70bsor) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0dc750c8bc6b8156eb31099a078d7f4d0213dee8/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2654)):_

> ``` C
> {
>     uint32_t size = 0;
> #define SIZE_OF_FIELD(NAME) size += sizeof(temp.NAME)
> ```

You could instead copy/paste the exact COPY_VALUE/COPY_ARRAY sequence and define them as adding sizeof to a `uint32_t data`. That way, it is indeed copy/paste, but it's clean copy/paste. Right now it's a derived copy/paste that can get out of sync. There isn't even a comment saying that it's the same as something else.

---

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2723 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWhJlQSqcrT6H3aexSC:-KWhJlQSqcrT6H3aexSD:b-uu3rfq) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0dc750c8bc6b8156eb31099a078d7f4d0213dee8/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2723)):_

> ``` C
>         if (m->friendlist[i].status > 0) {
>             struct SAVED_FRIEND temp;
>             memset(&temp, 0, saved_friend_size());
> ```

This is now wrong. `temp` is in fact of size `sizeof temp` or `sizeof(struct SAVED_FRIEND)`. Remove this line and change the declaration to `struct SAVED_FRIEND temp = { 0 };`.

---

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2808 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWhKdaRSqS0Q-Gz3IGs:-KWhKdaRSqS0Q-Gz3IGt:b-rhmu4w) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0dc750c8bc6b8156eb31099a078d7f4d0213dee8/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2808)):_

> ``` C
> 
>     for (i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
>         struct SAVED_FRIEND temp;
> ```

Add initialiser: `= { 0 }`.

---

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2654 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWjOacDo8K1-ZU8uucC:-KWjOacDo8K1-ZU8uucD:bn9wcs5) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c2af1e6e8292c831503cb514ac30d872566035d6/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2654)):_

Also, I'd suggest putting these on one line, given they are so trivial.

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2656 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWjXyyWq_CvOwBlJY5e:-KWjXyyXOn5yLMxrlGld:b-nh6oig) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ca5b9c724aff76d8b9680d2dce6cd0ebc0b7bc11/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2656)):_

> ``` C
>     const struct SAVED_FRIEND temp = { 0 };
> 
> #define COPY_VALUE(NAME) data += sizeof(temp.NAME)
> ```

These two defines don't appear to be copying anything. Need better names.

---

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2802 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWjXcwNWhm1LprfFTBr:-KWjXcwOTjfy4onhsF62:b-p5yccs) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ca5b9c724aff76d8b9680d2dce6cd0ebc0b7bc11/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2802)):_

> ``` C
> static int friends_list_load(Messenger *m, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t length)
> {
>     if (length % friend_size() != 0) {
> ```

You should assign friend_size() to a variable so you don't have to call it numerous times in the same function.

> ```

---

_[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2802 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-KWmnCulQihLDvuDql6G:-KWmnCulQihLDvuDql6H:b-6dfsmp) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4d9a2f6f47fff3a93cf064aea3b6e8a36c2cb1fb/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2802)):_

> ``` C
> static int friends_list_load(Messenger *m, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t length)
> {
>     const uint32_t friend_size = friend_size();
> ```

You can't reuse the name. Same in haskell: `let foo = foo ()` will fail to compile. (Another reason not to put it in a variable: you have to make up a new name - @jfreegman suggest a name :))

> Reverted to using a function. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281)_

This coul be avoided if we memcpy'ed the struct members into a file, instead of memcpy'ing the struct itself. Remember to never memcpy a struct in real code.

@robinlinden why was the `tox_one_test.c` modified?

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-:-KX-JA0X9rCio4Tn1tA5:b-tqb2d4)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

What could be avoided?

The test was modified to put the network test last. All other tests in tox_one_test are hermetic and don't rely on networking to work.

---

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-:-KX1ELN3ZfAg_nysMBxF:b-oo1bw1)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

> What could be avoided? The alignment issue this Pr fixes. It exists because toxcore was made to memcpy the struct into the savedata array as it is, instead of memcpy'ing its members. This could be avoided if we memcpy'ed the struct members into the savedata, instead of memcpy'ing the struct itself. Obviously, we can't redo this now, as it would break all existing savedata files and we better use some json/msgpack format if we are going to break it. So the takeaway form this is to remember to never memcpy a struct in real code. > The test was modified to put the network test last. All other tests in tox_one_test are hermetic and don't rely on networking to work. Ok. --- Reviewed 1 of 2 files at r1, 1 of 1 files at r5. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-:-KX3-YXBaeVyQBSiRmnc:b53gav7)_

I didn't verify that this wont eat existing save files. --- Reviewed 1 of 2 files at r1, 1 of 1 files at r5. Previously, robinlinden (Robin Lindén) wrote… > Done.
LGTM --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/281#-:-KX3FbsKN1HkFcyOnv4V:b7utbzx)*

labels.name: refactor

title: Made save format platform-independent
